name: Pumpkin Carrot Spinach Soup
description: This wholesome Pumpkin Carrot Spinach Soup is a perfect blend for those who enjoy low-carb, healthy recipes. With a high-sodium kick, minimal sugar, and packed with nutritious ingredients, it caters to anyone looking for a healthified twist to their meals. Whether you're looking for something warm during the colder months or a light and comforting meal, this soup will not disappoint.

recipeInstructions.text: Wash and roughly chop the spinach leaves.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: Add diced white onion to the pot and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Add the diced carrot and cook for another 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in garlic powder, salt, pepper, and fresh thyme, cooking for 1 minute until fragrant.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 6

recipeInstructions.text: Add the boiled pumpkin and water to the pot. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 7

recipeInstructions.text: Add the evaporated milk and spinach leaves to the pot. Stir well and continue cooking for an additional 5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 8

recipeInstructions.text: Use an immersion blender to puree the soup until smooth. If you prefer a chunkier soup, blend only half of the soup.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 9
